image.title: Core Team | Center of Complex Interventions

item.title: Samantha Bates
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Samantha Bates is the Executive Director of CCI where she sets the strategic vision for the organization, runs day-to-day operations, and works closely with the CCI research team on various research projects. Before CCI, Sam was the Director of Administration at YarnLabs Inc, a fiscal sponsor for non-profits. She also previously managed research at MIT […]
item.content:encoded: Samantha Bates is the Executive Director of CCI where she sets the strategic vision for the organization, runs day-to-day operations, and works closely with the CCI research team on various research projects. Before CCI, Sam was the Director of Administration at YarnLabs Inc, a fiscal sponsor for non-profits. She also previously managed research at MIT and worked as a researcher at Harvard Law School and the Berkman Klein Center for Internet & Society. Before entering the academic and non-profit space, Sam worked at Google. She has a master’s degree in Modern European History from the University of Cambridge and a B.A. in History from Grinnell College. When not running CCI, Sam can usually be found biking up New England’s finest gravel mountain roads.

item.title: Ondrej Holiencin
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Ondrej is an experienced IT architect, agile practitioner, certified scrum master, and consultant with a background in computer science and political economy. He participated in many international multimillion-dollar projects in finance, insurance, and banking. Ondrej works with the CCI operations team to set short-term and long-term goals for the organization and assists with project engagement […]
item.content:encoded:
Ondrej is an experienced IT architect, agile practitioner, certified scrum master, and consultant with a background in computer science and political economy. He participated in many international multimillion-dollar projects in finance, insurance, and banking.

Ondrej works with the CCI operations team to set short-term and long-term goals for the organization and assists with project engagement and the grant application process.

item.title: Karthik Dinakar
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Karthik Dinakar is a research affiliate at CCI. Karthik is a machine learning and clinical medicine scholar. He advises research projects at CCI. Karthik has a PhD in machine learning from MIT and is an alumnus of Carnegie Mellon University.
item.content:encoded: Karthik Dinakar is a research affiliate at CCI. Karthik is a machine learning and clinical medicine scholar. He advises research projects at CCI. Karthik has a PhD in machine learning from MIT and is an alumnus of Carnegie Mellon University.

item.title: Adam Mullinax
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Adam Mullinax is the Chief Financial Officer of CCI where he manages the budgets and financials of the organization, while also working closely with the other team members to help with key organizational and strategic initiatives. Separately, Adam is an investor and partner at Neoteny, an early-stage venture capital firm with a broad focus across […]
item.content:encoded: Adam Mullinax is the Chief Financial Officer of CCI where he manages the budgets and financials of the organization, while also working closely with the other team members to help with key organizational and strategic initiatives. Separately, Adam is an investor and partner at Neoteny, an early-stage venture capital firm with a broad focus across technology. Adam has a BS in Finance from the New York University, with a minor in history. While not working, Adam enjoys cooking, playing golf and spending time with his family and cats.

item.title: Kriti Godey
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Kriti Godey manages technology at CCI. She spends the bulk of her time leading the Mathesar project, an open source product to help users of all skill levels work with data. Most recently, she was Director of Engineering at Creative Commons (CC), where she built open source tools to make CC licenses easier to work […]
item.content:encoded: Kriti Godey manages technology at CCI. She spends the bulk of her time leading the Mathesar project, an open source product to help users of all skill levels work with data. Most recently, she was Director of Engineering at Creative Commons (CC), where she built open source tools to make CC licenses easier to work with. Prior to that, she focused on leading happy and productive distributed engineering teams at startups, and has enjoyed architecting and building both consumer-facing and enterprise software.

item.title: Dominykas Mostauskis
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Dominykas is a self-described technologist working on Mathesar. He’s passionate about facilitating change through better tools. He’s previously worked on a decentralized cryptocurrency exchange, technical trading software, and scientific programming. Outside working hours he likes running, swimming, and his pet guinea pigs.
item.content:encoded: Dominykas is a self-described technologist working on Mathesar. He’s passionate about facilitating change through better tools. He’s previously worked on a decentralized cryptocurrency exchange, technical trading software, and scientific programming. Outside working hours he likes running, swimming, and his pet guinea pigs.

item.title: Cristina Alonso
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Cristina Alonso is a Doctor of Public Health who has ample experience implementing systems change in complex political settings. Her doctoral dissertation, “The Impact and Social Response to COVID-19 in Chelsea, MA” won the national award for Outstanding Dissertation of 2021 by the DrPH coalition. She was co-founder of the Academic Public Health Corps which deployed over […]
item.content:encoded: Cristina Alonso is a Doctor of Public Health who has ample experience implementing systems change in complex political settings. Her doctoral dissertation, “The Impact and Social Response to COVID-19 in Chelsea, MA” won the national award for Outstanding Dissertation of 2021 by the DrPH coalition. She was co-founder of the Academic Public Health Corps which deployed over 1000 public health students and professionals to support local public health efforts during COVID. She then became a leader in coordinating Chelsea’s multi/disciplinary COVID response. Prior to working in COVID, Cristina worked for 18 years in Latin America improving the quality of care in maternal health. She founded several full-scope birth centers in Mexico and worked with the Mexican Ministry of Health to integrate midwifery into the health care system. Her book, “Open a midwifery center”, has been published in three languages and is considered the seminal textbook for opening birth centers in low-resource settings. Cristina continues to work in maternal health improvement consulting in Afghanistan and the USA.

item.title: Alexander James Phillips
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Alexander James Phillips believes that the world is an increasingly complex and uncertain place, and to understand it we need to improve our individual and collective sense making abilities. AJP is a researcher, biochemist and software engineer working with CCI to build tools that help us make sense of our complex and uncertain world, and […]
item.content:encoded:
Alexander James Phillips believes that the world is an increasingly complex and uncertain place, and to understand it we need to improve our individual and collective sense making abilities. AJP is a researcher, biochemist and software engineer working with CCI to build tools that help us make sense of our complex and uncertain world, and harness our conscious collective intelligence.

Early in the pandemic AJP helped co-found Helpful Engineering, the community for crowd sourced anti-covid action, and the OpenCovidPledge. Prior to these efforts to help resolve the pandemic sooner, he founded the crowdsourcing wiki simulations platform TheWorldSim.org. AJP has more than 10 years of experience in commercial software development, and holds a masters in biochemistry from the University of Oxford and a masters in biotechnology from the University of Cambridge.

item.title: Sean Colsen
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Sean is an engineer passionate about open source software, user experience, data, and interesting problems. He brings a background in tech, non-profits, CRMs, and community organizing to his work on our Mathesar project. In his free time he enjoys mountain biking, and carpentry.
item.content:encoded: Sean is an engineer passionate about open source software, user experience, data, and interesting problems. He brings a background in tech, non-profits, CRMs, and community organizing to his work on our Mathesar project. In his free time he enjoys mountain biking, and carpentry.

item.title: Daniel Begemann
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Daniel Begemann is a former CCI volunteer and policy simulator collaborator who is now working on CCI’s policy simulator projects full-time. He has an MSc in Data Science from the University of Liverpool, where his dissertation focused on epilepsy detection using EEG data. Prior to this, Dan worked in nonprofit administration in Washington, DC, as […]
item.content:encoded: Daniel Begemann is a former CCI volunteer and policy simulator collaborator who is now working on CCI’s policy simulator projects full-time. He has an MSc in Data Science from the University of Liverpool, where his dissertation focused on epilepsy detection using EEG data. Prior to this, Dan worked in nonprofit administration in Washington, DC, as well as at a public school. Dan is currently living in England. In his spare time, he enjoys volunteering, reading and writing, and playing sports.
